column4: Dell mini9 w/ Ubuntu on USB flash won't win any performance awards..  zykotick9  thank you, testing now.
Does it seem crazy that an OS who's roots started as a multi user OS (timesharing, etc), is now primarly a single user OS?
i dont use it as a primary single user...

These systems that have insane amounts of (CPU) power, massive amounts of memory, mostly just sitting and reading and writing to a TCP socket, doing a little video processing, etc - SO much more powerful than the timeshare systems of yesteryear... I'll be quiet now. Wow booting from USB is slow..
